channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024040462
item.description:
Report E-2024040462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 15th, 2024, at 11:47 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard in Nashville, Tennessee, reported GATX65584, a residue tank car of Sulfur, molten, was suspected to be leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, PCS Sales, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #20240408-00072). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a vapor release due to a hole in the tank shell nozzle. MEI personnel cleaned and purged the tank car to remove all hazardous residue. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Matt Paynter, Matt.paynter@nutrien.com, 706-564-8118). It was subsequently determined that repair costs exceeded car value; tank car will be cut for scrap on location.

item.title: Report E-2024050246
item.description:
Report E-2024050246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSESS) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the coating-impacted trailer and trailer, then swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and damaged product were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This Hazmat was found by a package handler during the inbound sort, while unloading a trailer. It was improperly loaded on the trailer. The supervisors informed the admin, the admin found the hazmat damaged and got the Hazmat Drum, cleaned up the spill, and put in the hazmat cage in a drum.

item.title: Report X-2024050359
item.description:
Report X-2024050359

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs f release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single mental can with closure tabs on the lid. The top chime was dented causing the lid to open and the contents to spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was found with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans inside with Styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. A lid on one of the cans was oose causing a release inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024050238
item.description:
Report E-2024050238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3266-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged product, and spent absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.
